posts.name: Eugene Fang

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Truly amazing work! Particularly like this: Swerve module states can be visualized in 2D or 3D by overlaying vectors on the odometry and 3D field tabs. Looking to go deeper? Try visualizing chassis speeds on the swerve tab, which can now display an unlimited number of data sets. I think you forgot to mention in your change log that you can drag components' poses to the robot's poses in order to visualize 3D components. Took me a while to figure that out.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked:
There’s lots of ground to cover but this behavior would be the new “nested objects” that are part of the redesigned control interface. The reason for the change is that it provides more flexibility for visualizing different components/vision targets/etc for multiple robots. I would recommend taking advantage of the new help menu for each tab (click the small question mark icon) which explains all of the available objects the supported data types and which are nested with other objects.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: We're always seeking new contributions to AdvantageScope. Instructions for building the application locally can be found at https://github.com/Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageScope. For opportunities to work on exciting projects, feel free to reach out to us through various platforms such as Chief, GitHub, or via email, where we can offer further guidance.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: AdvantageScope 2025 Beta 2 is now available. You can download it from the [GitHub releases page](https://github.com/Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageScope/releases/tag/v4.0.0-beta-2). This beta release introduces new controls for the 3D field camera, enhances performance across multiple tabs, and resolves several issues reported during development. The community feedback has been instrumental in shaping these updates. Thank you to everyone who has contributed suggestions and reported problems over the past few weeks.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: AdvantageScope 2025 Beta 3 is now available for download from the [GitHub releases page](https://github.com/Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageScope/releases/tag/v4.0.0-beta-3). This update includes a number of significant feature updates, such as the Unofficial REV-Compatible Logger (URCL) and Alerts Visualization, which allow users to log directly to DataLog instead of disabling NetworkTables. The Console Tab Improvements include enhanced functionality like color coding for warnings and errors, and the ability to filter messages. Additionally, users of the 2025 PhotonVision beta can view raw data in AdvantageScope without enabling protobuf logging. Running demos with AdvantageScope allows you to loop through events via the play/pause icon, providing detailed analysis of specific moments.

link_counts.title: Recording Faults with Persistent Alerts — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: The text describes the implementation of self-descriptive packed struct schemas using a new feature in PhotonVision's PhotonVision library. These schemas, implemented as a subset or extension of WPILib's Struct schema, support optional types and variable-length arrays without explicit bitfield support. They are stored in NetworkTables via the `/.schema/` directory, differentiated by their schema definition hashes. This approach replaces traditional Protobuf-like code generation with one that offers reduced overhead and faster encoding/decoding, while maintaining the ability to handle compile-time serialization and deserialization, as well as dynamic decoding for dashboards.
